message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Disagree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a primary or secondary school teacher from Bulgaria. I need to provide responses to all 10 statements.

Let me think about reasonable responses from the perspective of a thoughtful educator:

TT4G35A - AI helps write/improve lesson plans: This is generally true - many teachers see value in AI for this. I'd say "Agree"

TT4G35B - AI enables adapting material to different abilities: This is also a known capability of AI. "Agree"

TT4G35C - AI assists in supporting students individually: Yes, personalized learning is an AI capability. "Agree"

TT4G35D - AI supports students with specific needs: This is true for multilingual learners and special education. "Agree"

TT4G35E - AI helps automate administrative tasks: Definitely - this is a clear use case. "Strongly agree"

TT4G35F - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work: This is about plagiarism/academic dishonesty. This is a real risk. "Agree" or "Strongly agree"

TT4G35G - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate/correct: This is true - AI can make mistakes. "Agree"

TT4G35H - AI amplifies biases that reinforce misconceptions: This is a real concern about AI. "Agree"

TT4G35I - AI jeopardises privacy and security of student data: This is a legitimate concern. "Agree"

TT4G35J - AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches: This could happen. "Agree" or "Disagree" - I'll go with "Agree" as a reasonable concern.

Let me provide balanced responses that reflect both the benefits and risks of AI in education, as a thoughtful educator would.
